2:
Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity
\q and cleanse me from my sin.
3:
For I know my transgressions,
\q and my sin is always before me.
\q
6:
See, you desire trustworthiness in my heart;
\q in my heart you will make me know wisdom.
8:
Make me hear joy and gladness
\q so that the bones that you have broken may rejoice.
\q
9:
Hide your face from my sins
\q and blot out all my iniquities.
10:
Create in me a clean heart, God,
\q and renew a right spirit within me.
\q
11:
Do not drive me away from your presence,
\q and do not take your holy Spirit from me.
12:
Restore to me the joy of your salvation,
\q and sustain me with a willing spirit.
\q
13:
Then will I teach transgressors your ways,
\q and sinners will be converted to you.
14:
Forgive me for shedding blood, God of my salvation,
\q and I will shout for the joy of your righteousness.
\q
15:
Lord, open my lips,
\q and my mouth will express your praise.
\q
16:
For you do not delight in sacrifice, or I would give it;
\q you have no pleasure in burnt offerings.
17:
The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit.
\q You, God, will not despise a broken and a contrite heart.
\q
51:
\m
\d For the chief musician. A psalm of David; when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had slept with Bathsheba.
\q
